newsitem.title: FRANCE: ONIC forecast seen bearish for French wheat prices.
newsitem.headline: ONIC forecast seen bearish for French wheat prices.

text.p: A forecast by France's grain office ONIC for a record 1996 soft wheat harvest is expected to accelerate a decline in French wheat prices, dealers said on Wednesday.

In its first post-harvest estimate, ONIC said it was expecting a 1996 soft wheat crop of 33.8 million tonnes, well above its July estimate of 30.9 million tonnes and the 29.8 million tonnes harvested in 1995.
"It's going to have an impact on the market," a dealer said.
French wheat prices have slipped in recent weeks on a lack of export prospects and growing harvest pressure.
French wheat into Rouen was quoted at 885-890 francs per tonne, down from a high of 900 francs hit last Thursday.
The crop estimate, drawn up ahead of ONIC's monthly meeting on September 11, was well above recent trade estimates ranging from 31 to 32 million tonnes, one operator said.

But private crop analyst Strategie Grains had said on Monday the soft wheat crop could rise to between 33.3 and 33.7 million tonnes as a result of better than expected yields in northern and eastern France.
European Union officials now estimate the EU grain harvest at possibly 192 million tonnes, up from a previous estimate of 190 million, a senior EU farm official said earlier in the day.
